snippet: As the Breeders’ Cup, a two-day showcase of horse racing, begins Saturday, the sport is still mired in credibility and image problems linked to drug violations.
abstract: Joe Drape On horse Racing column holds that as Breeders’ Cup begins, sport is still mired in credibility and image problems linked to drug violations; Breeders’ Cup had aimed to ban race-day medication furosemide, sold as Lasix, in all of its races by 2013, but horsemen and some prominent owners threatened lawsuits and hinted at boycott, that forced Breeders’ Cup to abandon wider plan.
lead_paragraph: As the Breeders’ Cup, a two-day showcase of horse racing, begins Saturday, the sport is still mired in credibility and image problems linked to drug violations.

headline.main: Breeders’ Cup: Trainers Aren’t Helping as Drugs Damage Sport
headline.print_headline: Trainers Aren’t Helping as Drugs Damage Sport
